clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Effectiveness of a Balanced 3rd Generation HES Solution (Tetraspan®) After Cardiac Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Safety and Effectiveness of a Balanced 3rd Generation HES Solution (Tetraspan®) Versus Albumin Solution for Volume Replacement in Patients After Cardiac Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this randomized controlled trial in patients undergoing cardiac surgery is to show that a 3rd generation HES (Hydroxyethyl Starch) solution - Tetraspan® is as good as in terms of safety and effectiveness as the commonly used albumin based solution for volume replacement after the surgery.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Total volume at the time of removal of drains (48 hours after surgery on average)

secondary_outcome.measure: Volume of replacement fluids given after surgery at each group
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Summary of volume replacement at the time of discharge from ICU (48 hours after surgery on average)
End of hospitalization (5 days postsurgery on average)

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of kidney injury as defined by RIFLE criteria
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Duration of hospitalization after surgery (expected average duration of 5 days)

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of coagulopathy as defined by prolonged PT\PTT and abnormal thromboelastogram not due to clotting inhibitors during hospitalization.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Duration of hospitalization after surgery (expected average duration of 5 days)

secondary_outcome.measure: Volume of Transfused blood products during hospitalization postsurgery
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Duration of hospitalization after surgery (expected average duration of 5 days)

arm_group.description: Patients receiving the standard care of ringer-albumin as volume replacement after cardiac surgery
patients receiving a 3rd generation HES solution (tetraspan) for volume replacement after cardiac surgery

Patients receiving lactated ringer-albumin solution for volume replacement after cardiac surgery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Written informed consent must be obtained from the subject or his/her legal guardian before any assessment is performed.
- Male or Female subject, 18 years or older.
- Any elective cardiac surgery
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects with impaired liver function defined as an elevated level of ALT and AST over 100 U/L.
- Hyperhydration states (e.g. pulmonary edema, congestive heart failure).
- Renal failure with creatinine blood levels > 2.5 mg/dL or eGFR < 30 ml/min (calculated using the DMRD formula).
- Oliguria (UO<0.5ml\kg\hr) or anuria (not related to hypovolemia) more than 12 hours.
- Current Intracranial hemorrhage.
- Current, hard to balance hyperkalemia.
- Severe hypernatremia or severe hyperchloremia.
- Known hypersensitivity to hydroxyethyl starch or to any of the excipients.
